org.intellimate.izou.sdk.contentgenerator

Class ContentGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.intellimate.izou.sdk.util.AddOnModule
      • org.intellimate.izou.sdk.contentgenerator.ContentGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable, ResourceBuilderModel, ContentGeneratorModel, ContextProvider, Loggable, LoggedExceptionCallback, ResourceCreator, ExceptionCallback

    public abstract class ContentGenerator
extends AddOnModule
implements ContentGeneratorModel, ResourceCreator
    The Task of an ContentGenerator is to generate a Resources-Object when a Event it subscribed to was fired.

    When an Event this ContentGenerator subscribed to was fired, the ContentGeneratorManager will run the instance of it in a ThreadPool and generate(String eventID) will be called.

    • Method Detail

      • announceEvents

        public List<? extends EventModel<?>> announceEvents()
        this method is called to register for what Events it wants to provide Resources.

        The Event has to be in the following format: It should contain only one Descriptor and and one Resource with the ID "description", which contains an description of the Event.

        Specified by:
        announceEvents in interface ResourceBuilderModel
        Returns:
        a List containing ID's for the Events

      • announceResources

        public List<? extends ResourceModel> announceResources()
        This method is called to register what resources the object provides. just pass a List of Resources without Data in it.
        Specified by:
        announceResources in interface ResourceBuilderModel
        Returns:
        a List containing the resources the object provides

      • provideResource

        public List<ResourceModel> provideResource(List<? extends ResourceModel> list,
                                           Optional<EventModel> optional)
        this method is called when an object wants to get a Resource.

        Don't use the Resources provided as arguments, they are just the requests. There is a timeout after 1 second.

        Specified by:
        provideResource in interface ResourceBuilderModel
        Parameters:
        list - a list of resources without data
        optional - if an event caused the action, it gets passed. It can also be null.
        Returns:
        a list of resources with data

      • triggered

        public abstract List<? extends Resource> triggered(List<? extends ResourceModel> list,
                                                   Optional<EventModel> optional)
        this method is called when an object wants to get a Resource.

        Don't use the Resources provided as arguments, they are just the requests. There is a timeout after 1 second.

        Parameters:
        list - a list of resources without data
        optional - if an event caused the action, it gets passed. It can also be null.
        Returns:
        a list of resources with data
